channel.title: World history project
channel.description:
I have to make an ABC book of ancient greece. Sounds easy doesn't it? Well it isn't. Cany anyone help me.
Here are the letters I have done so far(I started yesterday):
1. a 2. b 3. c 4. d 5. e
Here are the letters I need help with:
f g h i j k l m n o p q r s t u v w x y z
If you have possible ideas for any of the letters that I don't know, type the letter and put the idea next to it (for example, a=ares)
Help would be very appreciated :D
p.s. i've used google to search for the letters i don't know, but with no credible resources, so don't flame me or anything

item.title: World history project
item.dc:creator: @script_owned4 script_owned4
item.description:
@script_owned4 wrote:

Rome Greece

Apollo Apollo
Bacchus Dionysus
Ceres Demeter
Cupid Eros
Diana Artemis
Fortuna
Janus
Juno Hera
Jupiter Zeus
Maia
Mars Ares
Mercury Hermes
Minerva Athena
Neptune Poseidon
Pluto Hades
Proserpina Persephone
Saturn Cronus
Uranus Ouranos
Venus Aphrodite
Vesta Hestia
Vulcan Hephaestus

Winds The Winds are Immortals who have chosen the air as their earthly bodies.
(Winds, Eos, Boreas, Eurus, Notus, Zephyros, North Wind, East Wind, South Wind, West Wind, Kaikias, Caicias, Apeliotes, Lips, Skiron, Sciron)

item.title: World history project
item.dc:creator: @hog hog
item.description:
@hog wrote:

f is for the ancient name Festus, check out http://www.ancientlibrary.com/smith-bio/1257.html
g is for gorgon, the race of Medusa
h is for Heracles (Hercules), or Hades, or Hammorabe.
i is for Incest
j is for Ilios, Greek name for Troy -story of the Trojan horse, Odysseus and Achilleus great battles
k is for Kataphract, the greatly feared Byzantine horsemen.
l is for Lycia a part of Greece.
n is for Nephertiti, Although Egyptian she married into Greek blood.
o is for Oedipus who married his mother and killed his father.
p is for Polynesian, Phonecian or Plebian, which means idiot in Greek and is a great insult.
q is for qwack, the sound a duck makes.
r is for Romulus and Remus, wolf boys who did what Cain and Abel did.
s is for Sophocles, writer of Oedipus
x is for Xatzidakis, a type of food.
y is for Yorick, look it up…
z is for Zorastrianism, the religion of the Persians and something Greek rulers feared.

Thats all I’ve got hope it helps.

Read full topic

item.title: World history project
item.dc:creator: @Silver_Lining Silver Lining
item.description:
@Silver_Lining wrote:

Here’s a few off the top of my head.
G=Greece(ofc).
H=Hephaestus.
O=oligarchy.
P=polytheism.
S=Sparta.
T=the muses.
Z=Zeus.

Also, a quick google got me this link: http://www.theoi.com/Encyc_I.html#K
